page.title: 01Loch Inbuair, Glendouchart
page.content: this block consists mainly of hill land which is farmed for sheep. A few cattle are kept on the low ground. There is a little forestry, mainly in the form of shelter-belts with a few plantations. Loch Inbuair (Loch of the yew trees) is a prominent beauty spot which is much admired in summer there is also fishing for salon and trount in its waters. At the east end of the Loch is a Picnic area and a small nature trial. The narrows at the east end of the Loch are liable to flooding after heavy rain and the road may be closed by flooding in winter. This will change over the next year when the road is re-reouted onto the course of the old Callander-Oban railway.
